div.ab: left-middleMeanings of the seven Colors in heraldry.

25. Two metals, Silver and Gold by name,
could not exist in noble coats of arms
by themselves; and likewise, colors
do not belong together without metals.
Among the Planets, Gold
is compared to the Sun; by the moon
we understand Silver; and Mars with red,
Mercury, messenger of the Gods, with Purple.
left-middleFixed order in heraldry, or the Coats of Arms of Nobles.
left-middleThe seven colors are like the seven Planets, which one should dress in its appropriate color

26. We liken Jupiter to Blue, Venus to green,
melancholy Saturn with Black.
In the same manner, one can compare
with colors the days of the week,
beginning with Sunday;
also the seven Virtues, without failing:
Faith with Gold; Silver is kindly Hope;
And ardent Love or Charity is Red.
left-middleAlso with the days of the week.
left-middleThe seven Virtues are like the colors.

27. Justice with the sky’s exquisite Blue;
Green is Strength, to persevere with dignity;
and Black, Wisdom or Prudence, modest in practice,
and two colors, whose names are lost,
mingled into one: Violet flesh-color,
which is like Temperance, moderate in its nature.
One can also compare liken these Colors to
the seven ages of human life.
left-middleThe seven Ages of Man’s life, compared to the colors.

29. Four types, or human temperaments,
can also compare to four colors, first Sanguine,
full of blood, with Red; quick-tempered Choleric
with Blue; and with White, the Phlegmatic,
slimy and phlegm-filled in all seasons;
Black corresponds with the sad face of melancholy.
Further, if we wish to identify the Elements,
left-middleFour colors compared to the four human Temperaments, and four elements.
